wikipedia_page.main: James Sauvage (born James Savage), (9 May 1849 – 27 November 1922) was a Welsh baritone singer.

response: Composers from the village include Caradog Roberts, best known for the hymn tune "Rachie"; and Arwel Hughes, conductor and composer of the hymn tune "Tydi a Roddaist". Notable performers from Rhos include the baritones James Sauvage, Andrew Griffiths and pianist Llŷr Williams.
* James Sauvage (born James Savage, 1849–1922), a Welsh baritone singer

The new building was designed by the county surveyor for Caernarfonshire, John Thomas, in the Gothic Revival style, built by a local contractor, Richard Williams, in buff brick and was officially opened on 31 August 1875. The opening was celebrated by two concerts, both conducted by Tanymarian, which included performances by the Welsh baritone singer, James Sauvage, in the presence of the local member of parliament, Morgan Lloyd.
